Unlike other languages R functions can't return multiple objects. One solution is to put the objects in a list. `return(list("alldata" = d.stats, "detectedonly" = d.stats.detected))`

These can be accessed with `d$alldata` and `d$detectedonly`

<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8936099/returning-multiple-objects-in-an-r-function>
